title: Roger Sherman
summary: Roger Sherman (April 19, 1721 â€“ July 23, 1793) was an early American statesman and lawyer, as well as a Founding Father of the United States. He is the only person to have signed all four great state papers of the United States: the Continental Association, the Declaration of Independence, the Articles of Confederation, and the Constitution,[1] and also signed the 1774 Petition to the King.
